sen.j: 酒造司（みきのつかさ、さけのつかさ）は、律令制の下で置かれた役所で宮内省の被官。
sen.e: Mikinotsukasa was a branch office of Kunaisho, placed under the ritsuryo legal code system.
Mikinotsukasa (also called Sakenotsukasa) was a branch office of Kunaisho, erected under the ritsuryo legal code system.

sen.j: 主な職務は酒や醴・酢などの醸造をうかさどった。
sen.e: Its main duty was supervising brewing of sake, amasake, and vinegar.

sen.j: 四等官は正（かみ）、佑（じょう）、令史（さかん）が1名ずつおかれ次官（すけ）に相当する職は置かれなかった。
sen.e: In Mikinotsukasa, the officials were placed according to Shitokan such as one for each of Kami, Jo, and Sakan and Suke was not placed.
In Mikinotsukasa, three Shitokan officials, i.e., Kami, Jo, and Sakan were placed; on the other hand, an official corresponding to Suke was not prepared.

sen.j: その他、酒部（さかべ）、使部などが置かれた。
sen.e: Also, Sakabe and Tsukaibe were placed.

sen.j: また、酒などを醸造するための酒殿（さかどの）が設置され、別当、弁などの職が置かれていた。
sen.e: Along with Sakadono for brewing sake settled in Mikinotsukasa, there were Betto and Ben placed.
